title: British tanker released by Iran docks in Dubai
text:
Stena Impero leaves the Bandar Abbas port in Iran | Mhdi Dehdar/AFP via Getty Images British tanker released by Iran docks in Dubai The vessel was seized by Iranian forces 10 weeks ago.

Stena Impero, the British tanker released by Iran after a 10-week detention, reached port in Dubai Saturday, the ship’s owners confirmed for Reuters.

Sailing under the British flag, the Stena Impero is owned by a Swedish company and crewed by Filipinos, Russians and Indians. The crew are in high spirits as they await their release at Port Rashid, according to Erik Hanell, chief executive of Stena Bulk, the firm that owns the U.K. tanker.

“They will be checked by medical professionals once ashore, but the captain has informed us all are in good health,” he told Reuters.

The tanker was confiscated by Iranian armed forces in July in retaliation to the U.K.’s seizure of an Iranian ship off Gibraltar. That vessel was suspected of transporting oil to Syria in breach of sanctions. The Iranian ship was released in August.

The news comes amid a broader standoff between Western allies and Iran over international transport rights through Strait of Hormuz.
description: The vessel was seized by Iranian forces 10 weeks ago.
